bibl.title: Robbers, Pirates and Licentious Women. Echoes of an Anti-Dionysiac Polemic in the Septuagint.
bibl.note: The classicist E. Bickermann thought that III Maccabees attests to the spread and importance of the Greek mysteries, particularly of Dionysiac rites, in Ptolemaic Egypt. Attempts to show that the author of III Maccabees not only criticizes the Greek mysteries which took place in Egypt, but all the Greek mysteries.
